channel.title: A client updater to connect
channel.description:
Thats all it does, so dont use any account you dont want getting banned. Dont forget about the UID! I do nothing to change it for you.
All it does is puts a hook into the main method to tell it you are connecting from the server world you use. (Well does change some text to warn you its gonna get you banned since it IS detectable.)
Needs the bcel library to compile the classes, and for the patcher to run. Put the rs jar into the RSJar directory.
Put the world you want to connect to in the run.bat and it sets it to the correct prefix (world 1 is set already).
Any questions dealing with the code or whatever just ask.

Olllie I was goofing off since this uses bcel…

[quote=“Pwnd, post:33, topic:14310”][quote author=Nerice link=topic=21376.msg254045#msg254045 date=1158590328]

Editing the client directly is a no-no. Use access methods. ;O

Editing the client is not a no-no…
[/quote]Access moethods are teh saf0r, since you’re not touching the client at all ;D[br][size=1]Posted at: September 19, 2006, 02:08:35 PM[/size][hr]Touching != HavingSex btw.[/quote]

Not really, all depends on how someone goes about it. Both could get you detected and banned, both can not at as well.

item.title: A client updater to connect
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Thanks for not stealing passwords this time regex:

[code]/* xLoader - Decompiled by JODE

  • Visit http://jode.sourceforge.net/
    */
    import java.applet.Applet;
    import java.applet.AppletContext;
    import java.applet.AppletStub;
    import java.awt.BorderLayout;
    import java.awt.Dimension;
    import java.net.URL;
    import java.net.URLClassLoader;
    import java.util.Properties;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

public class xLoader implements AppletStub
{
private static Properties params = new Properties();
private static JFrame frame;
private static JPanel game;

public static void main(String[] strings) {
new xLoader(strings);
}

private xLoader(String[] strings) {
try {
    URLClassLoader urlclassloader
	= (new URLClassLoader
	   (new URL[]
	    { new URL("http://po4.runescape.com/loader.jar") }));
    Class var_class = urlclassloader.loadClass("loader");
    Applet applet = (Applet) var_class.newInstance();
    applet.setStub(this);
    frame = new JFrame("NericeCantCode - New 2006 Loader");
    frame.setResizable(false);
    game = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
    game.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(765, 503));
    game.add(applet);
    frame.getContentPane().add(game, "Center");
    frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(3);
    frame.pack();
    frame.setVisible(true);
    applet.init();
    applet.start();
    boolean bool = true;
    while (bool == bool)
	System.out.println("Nerice Cant Code");
} catch (Exception exception) {
    System.out.println("Error, Quitting");
    System.exit(2);
}
}

public URL getCodeBase() {
URL url;
try {
    url = new URL("http://po4.runescape.com");
} catch (Exception exception) {
    return null;
}
return url;
}

public URL getDocumentBase() {
URL url;
try {
    url = (new URL
	   ("http://po4.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=1&plugin=0"));
} catch (Exception exception) {
    return null;
}
return url;
}

public String getParameter(String string) {
params.setProperty("width", "503");
params.setProperty("height", "765");
params.setProperty("worldid", "4");
params.setProperty("members", "0");
params.setProperty("modewhat", "0");
params.setProperty("modewhere", "0");
params.setProperty("lowmem", "1");
params.setProperty("lang", "0");
return params.getProperty(string);
}

public AppletContext getAppletContext() {
return null;
}

public void appletResize(int i, int i_0_) {
/* empty */
}

public boolean isActive() {
return true;
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic

i think that the people who cant get the client dont deserve to know.

anywho.

I Attatched my Loader. so you can see how much better it is then nerice shit
all you have to do it make an external class and to do
xLoader ldr = new xLoader();
then it should load it up k[/quote]
just put

java -cp . xLoader
pause

in a batch

but i spose if you want to build a bot off it then do it
but we should ask for source from u will

item.title: A client updater to connect
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:6, topic:14310”]Wtf Nerice, you seriously don’t get the point.

Your Method:

  1. Put runescape.jar into folder
  2. Run the Patcher
  3. Run the client

Loader Method:

  1. Put runescape.jar into folder
  2. Run the client[/quote]

Downside to loader method: processing time for each client execution, instead of once per version.

Read full topic

item.title: A client updater to connect
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Rictoo:

Ohhh, so this is for learning purposes >>

Yeah, or if someone just wants to be able to connect and no deal with doebs etc… like it seems, or at least it seemed and I have not seen the noobie type people that was learning changing over to differnt ways.

Like I hinted with changing the text by just seeing if there was a constant that matched and replacing it with my own (opps, index is not -1, its there, no looping trying to find out etc…). Can just as easily change a methodref to your methodref and every time they called that method in any classes you did that in it would call yours instead. That freaking easy. Gotta be careful though too doing stuff like that with methods, as its global to the entire class, but it can be very very useful for things as well.

Read full topic
